intro: Aulomyrcia obtusa var. panicularis, commonly known as the panicled aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences with small, five-petaled flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and ecological role within its native habitat.
